text: The Calabrian regional election of 1980 took place on 8 June 1980. ==Events== Christian Democracy was by far the largest party, while the Italian Socialist Party made important gains. After the election Bruno Dominijanni, a Socialist, formed a centre-left government comprising Christian Democracy, the Italian Democratic Socialist Party and the Italian Republican Party (organic Centre- left). ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%" |- bgcolor="EFEFEF" ! colspan=2|Parties ! votes ! votes (%) ! seats |- | bgcolor=White | | Christian Democracy | align=right|450,836 | align=right|41.2 | align=right|18 |- | bgcolor=Red | | Italian Communist Party | align=right|263,869 | align=right|24.2 | align=right|10 |- | bgcolor=Hotpink | | Italian Socialist Party | align=right|181,114 | align=right|16.6 | align=right|7 |- | bgcolor=Black | | Italian Social Movement | align=right|77,542 | align=right|7.1 | align=right|2 |- | bgcolor=Pink | | Italian Democratic Socialist Party | align=right|63,312 | align=right|5.8 | align=right|2 |- | bgcolor=Lime | | Italian Republican Party | align=right|22,977 | align=right|2.1 | align=right|1 |- | bgcolor=Darkred | | Proletarian Unity Party | align=right|13,006 | align=right|1.2 | align=right|- |- | bgcolor=Maroon | | Proletarian Democracy | align=right|12,254 | align=right|1.1 | align=right|- |- | bgcolor=Blue | | Italian Liberal Party | align=right|8,346 | align=right|0.8 | align=right|- |- |- bgcolor="EFEFEF" !colspan=2| Total | align=right|1,093,256 | align=right|100.0 | align=right|40 |- !colspan=5|File:Calabria Council 1980.svg |- !colspan=5|Largest party by municipality |- !colspan=5|File:Calabria 1980.png |} Source: Ministry of the Interior Category:Elections in Calabria Category:1980 elections in Italy
title: 1980 Calabrian regional election
